cluster_relations.rel_desc: As part of modern folklore, tales like urban legends circulate within communities of various sizes.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that an informational or cultural item circulates, is shared, or is transmitted within a given population or community context.

qualifiers.TemporalQualifier: as they are shared and retold
qualifiers.UncertaintyQualifier: generalization from urban legends to modern folklore

remarks: Generalizes from urban legends (a component of modern folklore) to modern folklore as a whole; somewhat extrapolated.
Generalizes from urban legends (a component of modern folklore) to modern folklore as a whole; somewhat extrapolated.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Oral storytelling facilitates the intergenerational transmission of tales.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject enables or makes easier the spread, transmission, or dissemination of the object (stories, tales, legends, or similar informational content).

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Interconnected societies facilitate the spread of urban legends.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject enables or makes easier the spread, transmission, or dissemination of the object (stories, tales, legends, or similar informational content).

qualifiers.ConditionExpression: became more interconnected through trade and travel

cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Community or group circulates or communicates stories or narratives among its members.

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: Effect: promotes community cohesion and protection

remarks: Assumes “these tales” refers to the previously mentioned stories/urban legends.
Assumes “these tales” refers to the previously mentioned stories/urban legends.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Advancements in technology greatly facilitate the spread of stories/urban legends.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject process or factor causally facilitates or enhances the dissemination or spread of the object information or stories.
remarks: Urban legends are a subset of stories; mapped to the stories entity.
Urban legends are a subset of stories; mapped to the stories entity.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Communication processes facilitate the spread of stories/urban legends.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject process or factor causally facilitates or enhances the dissemination or spread of the object information or stories.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The internet enables rapid sharing and dissemination of stories.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject enables or makes easier the spread, transmission, or dissemination of the object (stories, tales, legends, or similar informational content).

qualifiers.TemporalQualifier: In the age of the internet

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Social media platforms enable rapid sharing of stories.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject enables or makes easier the spread, transmission, or dissemination of the object (stories, tales, legends, or similar informational content).

qualifiers.TemporalQualifier: In the age of … social media

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Communication platforms and media facilitate the spread and proliferation of urban legends.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a subject enables, accelerates, or facilitates the dissemination or spread of a piece of information, content, or phenomenon.

qualifiers.CausalHint: as they are shared and reshared

llm_raw:
[
  {
    "function": "modify_rel_schema",
    "args": {
      "relation_ids": [
        "RelR_7dbeb3c42b67",
        "RelR_fb030b107649",
        "RelR_fdaaae10ce82",
        "RelR_34eeafe0fd1f",
        "RelR_fada4de96048",
        "RelR_9b6e14480eb6",
        "RelR_4339d7a83acf"
      ],
      "canonical_rel_name": "facilitates_dissemination_of",
      "canonical_rel_desc": "Indicates that the subject enables, accelerates, or otherwise facilitates the dissemination or spread of the object (such as information, stories, or legends).",
      "rel_cls": "dissemination_facilitation_relation",
      "rel_cls_group": "CAUSALITY",
      "justification": "All these relations describe a causal enabling or facilitation of the spread/dissemination of stories or urban legends by some medium, process, or technology. They are currently split across two very similar canonical names (\"facilitates_spread_of\" vs. \"facilitates_dissemination_of\") and two near-duplicate classes (\"information_dissemination_enabler_relation\" vs. \"dissemination_facilitation_relation\"), and one instance (RelR_4339d7a83acf) is misaligned in rel_cls_group (DISSEMINATION instead of CAUSALITY) despite clearly encoding a causal facilitation. Normalizing them to a single canonical predicate, a single facilitation-oriented rel_cls, and a CAUSALITY rel_cls_group yields a cleaner and more consistent KG schema for all causal dissemination-enabler edges.",
      "remark": "This normalization intentionally treats all media/process/technology factors that enable or speed up story/legend spread as instances of the same causal dissemination-facilitation predicate family.",
      "confidence": 0.93
    }
  }
]

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject enables, accelerates, or otherwise facilitates the dissemination or spread of the object (such as information, stories, or legends).
args.justification: All these relations describe a causal enabling or facilitation of the spread/dissemination of stories or urban legends by some medium, process, or technology. They are currently split across two very similar canonical names ("facilitates_spread_of" vs. "facilitates_dissemination_of") and two near-duplicate classes ("information_dissemination_enabler_relation" vs. "dissemination_facilitation_relation"), and one instance (RelR_4339d7a83acf) is misaligned in rel_cls_group (DISSEMINATION instead of CAUSALITY) despite clearly encoding a causal facilitation. Normalizing them to a single canonical predicate, a single facilitation-oriented rel_cls, and a CAUSALITY rel_cls_group yields a cleaner and more consistent KG schema for all causal dissemination-enabler edges.
args.remark: This normalization intentionally treats all media/process/technology factors that enable or speed up story/legend spread as instances of the same causal dissemination-facilitation predicate family.

executed_decisions.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject enables, accelerates, or otherwise facilitates the dissemination or spread of the object (such as information, stories, or legends).
executed_decisions.justification: All these relations describe a causal enabling or facilitation of the spread/dissemination of stories or urban legends by some medium, process, or technology. They are currently split across two very similar canonical names ("facilitates_spread_of" vs. "facilitates_dissemination_of") and two near-duplicate classes ("information_dissemination_enabler_relation" vs. "dissemination_facilitation_relation"), and one instance (RelR_4339d7a83acf) is misaligned in rel_cls_group (DISSEMINATION instead of CAUSALITY) despite clearly encoding a causal facilitation. Normalizing them to a single canonical predicate, a single facilitation-oriented rel_cls, and a CAUSALITY rel_cls_group yields a cleaner and more consistent KG schema for all causal dissemination-enabler edges.
executed_decisions.remark: This normalization intentionally treats all media/process/technology factors that enable or speed up story/legend spread as instances of the same causal dissemination-facilitation predicate family.
